Sudhana said:
May the sage please proclaim it for me.
I will rely on the Buddha's majestic spiritual power and the power of good and virtuous friends, and be able to believe, accept, understand, and enter.
The Bodhisattva said:
Good man!
I come from the world of Complete Auspiciousness and Radiance in the east, from the Buddha of Universal Auspiciousness and Birth.
Good man!
I obtained this Dharma door from that Buddha;
Since leaving there, an ineffable number of ineffably ineffable buddha-lands of atoms have passed;
In each thought, I take ineffable ineffably ineffable buddha-lands of atoms in steps;
In each step, I pass ineffable ineffably ineffable buddha-lands of atoms;
In each world, I enter everywhere with the most supreme mind, reaching the buddhas and making offerings with wonderful offerings, as well as bestowing them upon the ocean of all sentient beings.
All these offerings are accomplished by the unsurpassed mind, sealed by the Dharma of non-action, tolerated by all TathÄgatas, and praised by all Bodhisattvas.
Good man!

I also universally see all sentient beings in that world, knowing their minds and knowing their faculties. According to their understanding and desires, I manifest my body and speak the Dharma for them;
Sometimes emitting light, sometimes bestowing wealth and treasures, using various skillful means to teach, transform, and bring benefit and joy to them, without rest.
Just as in the east, so it is in the south, west, north, the four intermediate directions, above and below.
Good man!

I only attain this bodhisattva liberation of the unimpeded swift-acting universal gateway, able to quickly and universally reach all places. It is like how the bodhisattva-mahÄsattvas practice universally in accordance with [the needs of sentient beings], reaching everywhere in the ten directions.
The wisdom and realm are equal and without distinction;
Their bodies are well-arranged, pervading the entire Dharma realm.
They reach all paths, enter all lands, know all dharmas, observe all worlds equally, expound all Dharma gates, and deeply believe in and delight in all wondrous practices.
Simultaneously illuminating all sentient beings, they do not give rise to discrimination regarding the buddhas, and are unobstructed in all places.
How could I be able to know and explain their practices of merit and virtue?
Good man!
In the south there is a city called Gate Master, in which there is a deity named Great Heaven.
You should go ask him how a bodhisattva studies the bodhisattva practices and cultivates the bodhisattva path.
Then the youth Sudhana paid homage at the bodhisattva's feet, circumambulated him countless times, earnestly gazed upon him, took his leave, and departed.
